caption.p: Thymus vulgaris essential oil (TEO: 25, 150, and 300 μL/L) improved locomotion pattern and reduced anxiety in the novel tank diving (NTT) test. ( A) Representative locomotion tracking pattern of the control, scopolamine (Sco: 100 μM), and TEO (25, 150, and 300 μL/L) treated groups. ( B) Represent the time spent in the top/bottom zone by zebrafish in the tank in different groups. ( C) Represent the total distance travelled by zebrafish in the tank in different groups. ( D) Represent the average velocity of the zebrafish in different groups. Values are means ± S.E.M. ( n = 10). For Tukey’s post hoc analyses: ( B) Control vs. Sco (100 μM): ### p < 0.0001, Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (25 μL/L): ### p < 0.0001, Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (150 μL/L): ### p < 0.0001, and Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (300 μL/L): ### p < 0.0001; ( C) Control vs. Sco (100 μM): # p < 0.01, Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (25 μL/L): ## p < 0.001, Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (150 μL/L): ## p < 0.001, and Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (300 μL/L): ## p < 0.001; ( D) Control vs. Sco (100 μM): # p < 0.01, Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (25 μL/L): # p < 0.01, Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (150 μL/L): ### p < 0.0001, and Sco (100 μM) vs. TEO (300 μL/L): ### p < 0.0001.
